metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3885 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Integer overflow in the ljpeg_start function in dcraw 7.00 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted image, which triggers a buffer overflow, related to the len variable. It was discovered that FreeImage incorrectly handled photo files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted photo file, a remote attacker could cause FreeImage to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: darktable package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1').
dcraw package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.27-1').
exactimage package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.1-6').
freeimage package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.15.4-6').
kodi package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '16.0~rc3+dfsg2-1').
libraw package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.2-1').
